intro: Lophiolepis poluninii, commonly known as the St Helena endemic plant, is a unique species native to the island of St Helena in the South Atlantic Ocean. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and finely divided leaves. The plant is adapted to the island's unique climate and soil conditions, thriving in rocky and coastal environments. Due to its restricted habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species. Its botanical features make it an important subject for studies on island biogeography and conservation.
